name: clwlkiswlk
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))

stmt.origin: simplbi(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))
-| wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0[(ClWalks ` c1)]c2 → c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2)
⊣ (c0[(ClWalks ` c1)]c2 ↔(c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2 ∧(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))
-| wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0[(ClWalks ` c1)]c2 → c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2)
⊣ (c0[(ClWalks ` c1)]c2 ↔(c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2 ∧(c2 ` 0)=(c2 `(# ` c0))))

body.origin: |- wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))

comment: A closed walk is a walk (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 16-Feb-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
